meanings.definition: To estimate (something) as being less than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She keeps underestimating the time it takes to finish her homework.
meanings.sent2: Don't make the mistake of underestimating the power of kindness.
meanings.sent3: He chuckled at himself for underestimating the size of the pizza he ordered.
meanings.sent4: The team risked underestimating their opponent's determination to win.
meanings.sent5: Underestimating the impact of climate change can have serious consequences.

meanings.definition: To think or guess that (something) is smaller, less important, or less likely than it really is.
meanings.sent1: They are underestimating the effort required to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent2: Stop underestimating the value of spending time with loved ones.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be underestimating the size of the dog approaching.
meanings.sent4: She realized she had been underestimating the depth of her own emotions.
meanings.sent5: Underestimating the potential of a child can hinder their growth and development.
